strIntroduction: Visit a traditional handicraft exhibit, a local shrine and shopping areas popular with Hakata natives Explore the Hakata townhouse museum and handicraft exhibit to learn about traditional manufacturing skills Pay a visit to the Kushida shrine, a popular place of worship and see the traditional floats which take part in an annual 5km race Enjoy both a local street shopping and mall experience at Hakata Kawabata shopping street and Hakata Riverain mall Explore the Hakata townhouse museum and handicraft exhibit to learn about traditional manufacturing skills Pay a visit to the Kushida shrine, a popular place of worship and see the traditional floats which take part in an annual 5km race Enjoy both a local street shopping and mall experience at Hakata Kawabata shopping street and Hakata Riverain mall What We Love:   What We Love: As a historical trading hub, Hakata was once the center of goods being traded all over Japan and internationally. Before the shopping begins, visit locally famed Kushida shrine, the annual summer Hakata Gion Yamakasa festival is dedicated to the shrine and the intricately designed 10 meter high floats are displayed year round. As the traditional manufacturer of Japanese 'Hakata ningyo' dolls, the exhibition of the dolls and other local handicrafts are a must see in Fukuoka. Begin your real shopping expedition at Hakata's Kawabata shopping street - with over 100 stores it's hard to resist the souvenirs on offer. Continue on to the Hakata Riverain mall where you will also have the chance to sample various Japanese sauces accompanied by the local knowledge of your guide and translator.

Discover the beautiful old streets and architecture of Hakata and find out about the local wares that the city is known for Walk through a Meiji period alley with classic architecture and various temples surrounding it Browse hakata dolls designed as seasonal gifts, and enjoy a special Obon festival lantern exhibition in summer Visit traditional local stores on Saimon Street - some with over 100 years of history Walk through a Meiji period alley with classic architecture and various temples surrounding it Browse hakata dolls designed as seasonal gifts, and enjoy a special Obon festival lantern exhibition in summer Visit traditional local stores on Saimon Street - some with over 100 years of history What We Love:   What We Love: Start off this unique Hakata tour by visiting a store selling the famous Japanese dolls the city is known for. Stroll down a quaint old street built in the Meiji period, the traditional architecture and atmosphere rivals that of Kyoto. Pay a visit to local temples including famous Shofukuji Temple, founded by the priest Yousai and the first Zen temple ever built in Japan. Yousai is crediting with first introducing tea to Japan from China. Next make your way to Saimon Kamaboko, a local store selling fish processed food for over 100 years. End the tour at the Nagasawa gift store to purchase souvenirs to remember your time in historic Hakata.

Travel to significant sites of Hakata and Fukuoka's trading past including shopping streets and produce markets Sip tea and relax at Rakusui Garden, a graceful pond garden built in the Meiji era Walk down Minoshima shopping street where you will experience Showa period shops and customs Enjoy the fresh seafood and vegetables at Yanagibashi Market Sip tea and relax at Rakusui Garden, a graceful pond garden built in the Meiji era Walk down Minoshima shopping street where you will experience Showa period shops and customs Enjoy the fresh seafood and vegetables at Yanagibashi Market What We Love:   What We Love: The historically strategic trading port of Hakata is still brimming with the merchant atmosphere of its past. At the Minoshima shopping street, be transported back to the Showa period where you will be able to experience the warmth and friendliness of local merchants who own family-run businesses. After you have indulged in traditional snacks and browsed local produce and trinkets, continue onwards to Yanagibashi market which is also known as 'Hakata's Kitchen'. This has been the main source of meat, fish, vegetables and other local produce for restaurants and residents of Fukuoka for over 100 years.

Be transported to the European style theme park, Huis Ten Bosch, with ease and comfort with round trip train tickets from Hakata Station in Fukuoka Enjoy a quick and stress-free ride from Hakata to Huis Ten Bosch theme park with express round trip train tickets Enjoy the Dutch-themed attractions of Huis Ten Bosch theme park with expansive grounds covering over 1 million sq meters See different flowers around the park depending on which season you go including tulips, roses, sunflowers and begonias Enjoy a quick and stress-free ride from Hakata to Huis Ten Bosch theme park with express round trip train tickets Enjoy the Dutch-themed attractions of Huis Ten Bosch theme park with expansive grounds covering over 1 million sq meters See different flowers around the park depending on which season you go including tulips, roses, sunflowers and begonias What We Love:   What We Love: A charming theme park in Nagasaki Prefecture, Huis Ten Bosch is named after one of the official residences of the Dutch royal family. Translating to 'House in the Woods', Huis Ten Bosch has been perfectly recreated to resemble Dutch style with copies of Netherlands architecture, beautiful gardens, iconic windmills and long canals. The train shuttles you from Japan to the streets of Europe with no need to worry about traffic, giving you more time to spend exploring the 700 species of tulips and the four meter high Tulip Mt. Fuji! If you're visiting during winter, prepare to be dazzled by the Kingdom of Lights, where the entire park is aglow with over 13 million multicolor lightbulbs.
strTitle: Huis Ten Bosch Ticket & Train Pass

strIntroduction: Round trip Fukuoka to Nagasaki train tickets plus a full day pass for the Nagasaki electric trams will make Nagasaki a convenient day trip in Japan Enjoy an efficient and speedy Shinkansen train from Hakata to Nagasaki with express round trip train tickets Take advantage of the one day unlimited Nagasaki tramway pass to visit the city's best landmarks Enjoy the flexibility of self-collecting your tickets or having them mailed to you Enjoy an efficient and speedy Shinkansen train from Hakata to Nagasaki with express round trip train tickets Take advantage of the one day unlimited Nagasaki tramway pass to visit the city's best landmarks Enjoy the flexibility of self-collecting your tickets or having them mailed to you What We Love:   What We Love: As a center of Portuguese and Dutch influence throughout the 16th and 19th centuries, the small fishing village of Nagasaki has today developed to become an East-meets-West city boasting a fusion of churches, shrines and temples. Most people are familiar with Nagasaki as the city to experience the world's second atomic bombing during World War II. The Peace Park was established close to the center of the explosion to commemorate the atomic bombing of Nagasaki and as a symbol of peace for the future. Rich in history and culture, Nagasaki is a great place to visit as a day trip from Fukuoka. With discounted train travel from Fukuoka to Nagasaki with express round trip tickets plus a one day pass on Nagasaki electric trams, getting there and around will a breeze.

Visit the stunning Kumamoto Castle and other landmarks with discounted round trip train tickets from Fukuoka and an inter-city travel pass for Kumamoto Get the ultimate convenience for a stress-free ride from Hakata to Kumamoto with express round trip Shinkansen train tickets Enjoy the Waka Waka 1 day pass for unlimited travel on the city's buses, trains and trams Explore the city with the famous Kumamon mascot, Japan's most popular bear Get the ultimate convenience for a stress-free ride from Hakata to Kumamoto with express round trip Shinkansen train tickets Enjoy the Waka Waka 1 day pass for unlimited travel on the city's buses, trains and trams Explore the city with the famous Kumamon mascot, Japan's most popular bear What We Love:   What We Love: Located in the center of Kyushu Island, the name Kumamoto means 'origins of the bear' - so it's no surprise then that the cute black bear with red cheeks known as 'Kumamon' is the beloved mascot of the city. The pride of the city is Kumamoto Castle - the 400 year old castle is known to be one of the most beautiful in Japan. At the heart of the city, hundreds of blossoms fill the castle grounds during the cherry blossom season. Other noteworthy landmarks are Suizenji Gardens, Shiki no Sato Park, Kumamoto Prefectural Traditional Crafts Center and Hasokawa Gyobutei. In addition, with the one day Waka Waka pass, you get unlimited travel on all buses, trams and trains in the city!

strIntroduction: Bath in therapeutic comfort at a traditional hot spring resort in Fukuoka and explore the natural sights of northern Kumamoto's spectacular waterfall Enjoy a hot spring bath at the famous Kurokawa Onsen Village, one of Japan's best hot spring resorts Have the added flexibility of choosing your preferred itinerary and time spent at onsens – relax to the fullest or spend some time exploring the region Visit the newly discovered tourist location, Nabegataki Falls, a favorite spot for avid photographers with its 20 meters wide cascade Enjoy a hot spring bath at the famous Kurokawa Onsen Village, one of Japan's best hot spring resorts Have the added flexibility of choosing your preferred itinerary and time spent at onsens – relax to the fullest or spend some time exploring the region Visit the newly discovered tourist location, Nabegataki Falls, a favorite spot for avid photographers with its 20 meters wide cascade What We Love:   What We Love: Relax at the Kurokawa Onsen which is renowed for its traditional ryokans and outdoor hot springs where visitors are able to enjoy the therapeutic waters in a natural setting. With around 300 years of history, the onsen resort was traditionally patronized by wealthy visitors as a rest stop on their travels. Take your pick from a range of outside baths with a variety of different waters – you'll also be able to enjoy your bath in peace as the mornings are typically the quietest time of the day. After a refreshing bath, head over to natural cascading Nabegataki falls – the 20 meters wide falls is a rare formation from Mount Aso's eruptions over 90,000 years ago.

Travel to two regions, Kurokawa and Aso, known for their natural beauty on a Fukuoka day tour for an outdoor hot spring bath and volcanic mountain views Enjoy an outdoor hot spring bath at a Kurokawa onsen spa suited to your preferences Take in the view of the caldera at the Aso region from the famous Daikanbo viewpoint Learn about the myths and festivals in the Aso region at one of the oldest shrines in Japan Visit two beautiful regions in one day with a customized tour plan Enjoy an outdoor hot spring bath at a Kurokawa onsen spa suited to your preferences Take in the view of the caldera at the Aso region from the famous Daikanbo viewpoint Learn about the myths and festivals in the Aso region at one of the oldest shrines in Japan Visit two beautiful regions in one day with a customized tour plan What We Love:   What We Love: Fit two must see places in Kyushu region into a day tour with special guides who personalize your tour around the best attractions in both Aso and Kurokawa. With a mind-boggling array of outdoor hot springs to choose from with different views, sizes, privacy and settings, discuss your preferences with your guide to get the best onsen to suit you. Then, head to Aso for a stunning panoramic view of the whole active volcano or a special drive to Laputa Road where the caldera edge looks to be floating in a sea of clouds. The personalized itinerary allows you to relax throughout the day while not missing out on places high on your bucket list.
strTitle: Kurokawa Onsen and Aso Day Tour

strIntroduction: Travel to Takachiho Gorge, the epitome of Japanese natural beauty, for boating, nature walks and ancient landmarks visits Take a walk along Takachiho Gorge and hear of the many ancient myths surrounding the stunning rock formations Enjoy the convenience and ease of a small group tour and avoid long queues for boating in the gorge with an early start Visit several cave locations which are connected to ancient Japanese mythology and folklore Enjoy refreshing cold wheat flour noodles, soumen, served inside bamboo pipes during the summer months Take a walk along Takachiho Gorge and hear of the many ancient myths surrounding the stunning rock formations Enjoy the convenience and ease of a small group tour and avoid long queues for boating in the gorge with an early start Visit several cave locations which are connected to ancient Japanese mythology and folklore Enjoy refreshing cold wheat flour noodles, soumen, served inside bamboo pipes during the summer months What We Love:   What We Love: Trace the paths of the gods and travel to one of the most beautiful scenic spots in Kyushu, the Takachiho Gorge. The natural wonder was formed from a natural phenomenon by the Aso volcanos when sudden cooling led to spectacular cliffs that rise between 80 to 100 meters above the river. Some of the region's most sacred and mythical locations can be found around the gorge such as Takachicho Shrine, an 1800 year old shrine home to a grove of evergreen trees which can claim an impressive 800 years. One of the best ways to view the gorge is by boat – come face to face with the 17 meter Manai Falls on your half hour paddle.

Get an enriching Japanese cultural experience on a Yanagawa cruise or Daizaifu Shrine stroll in a beautiful kimono Choose from a wide variety of high quality kimonos and accessories Enjoy a professional kimono rental service with dressing assistance Wear a beautiful kimono as your walk down the streets to gain free access to selected attractions Choose from a wide variety of high quality kimonos and accessories Enjoy a professional kimono rental service with dressing assistance Wear a beautiful kimono as your walk down the streets to gain free access to selected attractions What We Love:   What We Love: Cruise down the Yanagawa river as the skipper sings the rhymes of a local Japanese poet whilst leisurely steering the wooden boat. Dressed in an delicate kimono and clogs alongside the traditionally dressed skipper, transport yourself into the past. Or you might decide to pay a visit to the Dazaifu Tenmangu Shrine instead, one of Fukuoka's most important shrines, dedicated to the great scholar Sugawara Michizane. Walk through the shrine grounds in your ornate kimono and observe students praying for academic success. No matter where you decide to go, there will be many beautiful photo opportunities so bring a fully charged camera!

Ride past a breathtaking harbor scene from the raised seat of your rickshaw and have your guide take many photos of you, while explaining the historical tales attached to each renaissance building you pass. Don't forget to find out at which social club Einstein stayed at during his visit to Japan. Your relaxing rickshaw tour will come to an end at a convenient location of your choice.

strIntroduction: Spend the morning 'slow' scuba diving and snorkeling in the pristine waters of Kyafa Beach Try out 'slow' scuba diving where you are able to immerse yourself fully underwater but still breathe normally See hundreds of species of fish and colorful coral in the waters of Kyafa Beach The environmentally conscious team will explain the importance of coral reef preservation and conservation while engaging in eco snorkeling and diving Try out 'slow' scuba diving where you are able to immerse yourself fully underwater but still breathe normally See hundreds of species of fish and colorful coral in the waters of Kyafa Beach The environmentally conscious team will explain the importance of coral reef preservation and conservation while engaging in eco snorkeling and diving What We Love:   What We Love: Immerse yourself in the underwater beauty of Okinawa with this unique 'slow' scuba diving method allowing you to breathe as if you're on land as your entire face is protected from water. The guided activity is a safe and fun way to discover underwater wonders without having to scuba dive with full gear – perfect for beginners or those wary to try out the full scuba dive. The team of professional divers is skilled, friendly and passionate in maintaining an eco friendly diving environment free from harmful practices. Discover 4 species of clown fish and a host of other sea creatures in the clear blue waters of Kyafa Beach!

The increased flexibility and streamlined profile creates a unique, zero gravity diving experience. With one-on-one guidance throughout the day, you'll encounter the magnificent beauty of the tropical coral reefs in Okinawa. Take the kids to see a huge variety of underwater creatures including manta rays, whale sharks, seahorses and more. At the Aquarium discover an intriguing world of marine life found in and around Okinawa displayed before you in some of the most high tech aquarium facilities in Japan. With its enormous capacity, the gigantic Kuroshio Sea Tank is where you can spot the largest fish in the world - the mighty whale shark, as well as the world's first successfully bred-in-captivity manta ray. An awe-inspiring experience awaits as you unfold these endless wonders of our amazing blue planet!

Ryusen has 43 years of history and has long played a big part in the Okinawan dyeing culture. Coral dyeing uses the natural shapes of coral to create your own pattern, then you can use this to create a gift such as a t-shirt or even a handbag. In Okinawa, corals are believed to bring happiness and bring prosperity and longevity, and with this in mind enjoy the experience with the kids and get them involved in finding out more out Okinawan culture in a fun and interactive way. The perfect day out for the whole family to enjoy!

Located just south of the city of Naha the Okinawa Beach Park offers picnic tables, beach volley ball courts, showers, restrooms, plenty of shade, white sand beaches, a calm swimming area, stunning views and a number of bouncy water slides. With such a wide variety of activities, it's no wonder that the park is Okinawa's most popular water park. Featuring numerous thrilling rides and child-friendly attractions, the park truly has something for everyone. You're certain to find more than enough to entertain you for the whole day for you and the family at what is arguably the biggest and best water park in Okinawa.

Showcasing the crystal clear sea and the underwater life that naturally inhabits this part of the vast Pacific Ocean, come and enjoy a trip around the Okinawa Prefecture where guests have the unique opportunity to see below the surface of the water and enjoy the wildlife and ocean vegetation below. As an alternative to diving or snorkeling, the ORCA is the safe and dry way to experience the deep blue. To get the best views, peer through the glass and see a thriving underwater ecosystem teeming with reefs, fish and other marine life. A truly magical experience!

Enjoy a wonderful day out for the whole family and discover the amazing nature on show at Bios Park, a tranquil garden in Okinawa Take in the peaceful scenery of one of Japan's best urban gardens and parks Let the kids run wild and play with the cute and friendly wild animals on site Enjoy a 25 min boat ride through some of the park's most serene areas (optional) Take in the peaceful scenery of one of Japan's best urban gardens and parks Take in the peaceful scenery of one of Japan's best urban gardens and parks Let the kids run wild and play with the cute and friendly wild animals on site Let the kids run wild and play with the cute and friendly wild animals on site Enjoy a 25 min boat ride through some of the park's most serene areas (optional) Enjoy a 25 min boat ride through some of the park's most serene areas (optional) What We Love:   What We Love: Located in the peaceful surroundings of Ishikawa City, Bios Hill is the perfect location for a great family day out in Okinawa's blissful nature. Covering a considerable area, the park is a nature lover's dream with a forest where giant ferns grow in abundance, and a lake shore where wild birds and insects gather. Throughout the park, orchids bloom naturally from every corner, and a dense subtropical forest spreads. It's here you can enjoy the bounties of Mother Nature either by taking a gentle walk through the grounds or on board a boat. The boat ride lasts for around 25 minutes and takes you through some of the most stunning parts of the park. With lily ponds to discover, goats and pigs on the loose, and water buffalo cart rides, Bios Hill is a great option for families and nature lovers alike!

Discover the delights of Neo Park in Okinawa and sample some of the region's most fascinating wildlife at this unique zoo Visit one of Japan's best outdoor parks and botanical gardens Discover thousands of species of plants and animals all in one space Board the park's miniature train for some fun with the family (optional) Visit one of Japan's best outdoor parks and botanical gardens Visit one of Japan's best outdoor parks and botanical gardens Discover thousands of species of plants and animals all in one space Discover thousands of species of plants and animals all in one space Board the park's miniature train for some fun with the family (optional) Board the park's miniature train for some fun with the family (optional) What We Love:   What We Love: Enjoy a magical experience discovering Okinawa's natural environment at the captivating Okinawa Neo Park. In the heart of Nago City, Neo Park has nurtured a huge, open natural park introducing the most fascinating aspects of Okinawa's nature. At Flamingo Lake visitors are welcomed by the amazing sight of a multitude of free flying birds, whilst the park also features fresh water ponds, tropical flowers, and exotic animals. The park also houses replicas of animal habitats found in the Amazon jungle, African savannah, Southeast Asia and Oceania, a real treat for the kids to learn more about the animal kingdom. Finish the day's fun feeding the many rare animals and birds of the park or visit the petting zoo. Truly a memorable experience for the whole family to enjoy!

After a 10-minute crash course on getting the hang of your snorkeling gear, you'll get to trace the underwater surface of the islands and explore Kerama's renowned biodiversity. Speed to the sites aboard Love or Lucky, the fastest dive boats in Okinawa exclusive to the operator, and share stories of the sea over a delicious Japanese lunch. It's a full day of waterworld fun, basking in the vast marine beauty of Kerama!

Marvel at the beauty of sea turtles, clown triggerfish, and other marine creatures that make the colorfully diverse ecosystem. Cruise down the Chao Praya river Tour around 'Dessert' Island by bike Get a special lesson in pottery making Learn about the island's desserts on a canal cruise Cruise down the Chao Praya river Cruise down the Chao Praya river Tour around 'Dessert' Island by bike Tour around 'Dessert' Island by bike Get a special lesson in pottery making Get a special lesson in pottery making Learn about the island's desserts on a canal cruise Learn about the island's desserts on a canal cruise What We Love:   What We Love: If the big city of Bangkok is proving to be a little intense for you, then a short city escape to Koh Kret or "Dessert Island" maybe just what the doctor ordered. Situated on a canal, Koh Kret is a haven of local life, luscious greenery and local specialities. Let the wind rustle your hair as you sail down river before arriving at the island to start the 7km bike ride around the island. Along the way meet and greet the locals, before stopping at an artisan village to get a class in pottery making. Master the wheel and create yourself a piece of pottery with your own special touch. After lunch trade your peddles for a paddle and set out on a canal trip into the 'dessert' canal where you will learn about and try to make some of the sweet treats produced on this island. Finally check out the floating market before heading back to the big city.

Discover Thailand's first ever national park – the beautiful Khao Yai – on an all-day tour from Bangkok and see exotic animals and birds with the backdrop of the evergreen forest Visit Thailand's first national park - Khao Yai - stretching over an area of 2,168 square kilometers Breathe in the fresh air of the evergreen forest and diverse vegetation – up to 2,500 species Catch a glimpse of exotic animals, birds, crocodiles, elephants and more – the reserve is home to 60 mammals and 300 bird species Khao Yai National Park is a great spot to discover nature with family and friends Visit Thailand's first national park - Khao Yai - stretching over an area of 2,168 square kilometers Visit Thailand's first national park - Khao Yai - stretching over an area of 2,168 square kilometers Breathe in the fresh air of the evergreen forest and diverse vegetation – up to 2,500 species Breathe in the fresh air of the evergreen forest and diverse vegetation – up to 2,500 species Catch a glimpse of exotic animals, birds, crocodiles, elephants and more – the reserve is home to 60 mammals and 300 bird species Catch a glimpse of exotic animals, birds, crocodiles, elephants and more – the reserve is home to 60 mammals and 300 bird species Khao Yai National Park is a great spot to discover nature with family and friends Khao Yai National Park is a great spot to discover nature with family and friends What We Love:   What We Love: Discover the true beauty of Thailand's nature in its first national park – Khao Yai, covering an area of 2,168 square kilometers in four provinces: Prachin Buri, Nakhon Ratchasima, Nakhon Nayok, and Saraburi. Located just two hours away from Bangkok, Khao Yai is one of the country's best-known natural reserves, making it the perfect escape into nature, just a day trip from Bangkok. Discover the evergreen forest, breathe in the fresh air with exotic flower scents and listen out for the park's friendly inhabitants: hornbills, trogons and cuckoos – just to name a few. The park is home to up to 2,500 plant species, 60 mammals and 300 bird species. Sightings of wild elephants, crocodiles and other creatures in their natural habitat are not rare too! Your visit to the park will also include a 30-minute elephant ride and a fun visit to Chokchai Farm.

Discover the ancient city of Ayutthaya, the former royal capital, on a 3-4 hour biking adventure Admire the beautiful local scenery and some of Thailand's best known historical landmarks Visit Ayutthaya Historical Park, a UNESCO World Heritage Site since 1991, Pom Phet (known as 'Diamond Fortress'), Wat Phra Sri Sanphet, Wat Mahathat and more Explore the rich local culture and cuisine at a street market Discover the ancient city of Ayutthaya, the former royal capital, on a 3-4 hour biking adventure Discover the ancient city of Ayutthaya, the former royal capital, on a 3-4 hour biking adventure Admire the beautiful local scenery and some of Thailand's best known historical landmarks Admire the beautiful local scenery and some of Thailand's best known historical landmarks Visit Ayutthaya Historical Park, a UNESCO World Heritage Site since 1991, Pom Phet (known as 'Diamond Fortress'), Wat Phra Sri Sanphet, Wat Mahathat and more Visit Ayutthaya Historical Park, a UNESCO World Heritage Site since 1991, Pom Phet (known as 'Diamond Fortress'), Wat Phra Sri Sanphet, Wat Mahathat and more Explore the rich local culture and cuisine at a street market Explore the rich local culture and cuisine at a street market What We Love:   What We Love: This tour takes you on a discovery adventure around Phra Nakhon Si Ayutthaya – the Sacred City of Ayutthaya, founded in 1350 and proudly holding the title of the Siamese royal capital until 1767. The first stop of the biking tour invites you to Pom Phet, also known as 'Diamond Fortress'. You will then explore local neighbourhoods on the way to 'Roti Road', where you will get to taste signature Thai delicacies recommended by your experienced guide. Cycle though the calm Somdet Phra Srinakarinda Park to the next stop at Chedi Phra Si Suriyothai memorial where you will have time to take loads of memorable photos before heading out to visit a Muslim community, Ayutthaya Historical Park and two of Thailand's well-known temples: Wat Phra Sri Sanphet and Wat Mahathat. The Ayutthaya biking adventure concludes with a shopping spree at a local market and a ferry across Palak River before making your own way to your next destination.

A haven for the new generation of gourmands, explorers and souvenir hunters, Chinatown is a one kilometer strip next to Charoenkrung Road and is a busy area lined with market stalls, street restaurants, gold shops and the clamors of excited sellers eager to flog their wares. Hectic, bustling and vibrant, the contagious energy of Bangkok's Chinatown is not an experience to miss.

Flying dancers, meticulously designed backdrops, and heart-thumping sound scores all tell the story of Siam and its colorful heritage. Hark back to ancient times, with the city as a crossroad for civilizations. Glimpse Buddhist and Muslim customs, performed in harmonious ceremony. Partake in village celebrations and daily peasant life, and learn about the shared belief in karma, as well as mystical netherworlds Hell and Himpaan, a forest between heaven and earth. With riveting Thai dances and charming folk music set to spectacular effects, you're in for a wildly entertaining show, that takes you into the heart and mind of Thailand.

Following the story of three harried cooks under pressure to cater to a wedding banquet – together with their manager's ill-equipped nephew, who is to learn how to cook while on the job – the award-winning performance is equal parts entertaining, humorous, and delightful. It's also a non-verbal production – and with gestures and movements doing all the talking, you're sure to get a universally enjoyable show, sans all the cultural barriers! Get a glimpse of traditional Korean samul nori, a type of rhythmic music performed with four instruments. Enjoy a dramatic, spine-tingling production involving the harmonious cacophony of cooking utensils, and be treated to a show by world-class performers – who also invite audience participation! A showcase of sound and action, artistic and cultural expression, the Nanta Show is a must-see for all!

At Ancient Siam, you'll feel as if you've walked through the entire Thailand in a day. The 'city', one of the largest outdoor museums in the world, is essentially a scaled-down version of the country, with many replicas and reconstructions of Thailand's historically significant structures. See temples, palaces, and shrines, and feel transported back in time as you make your way around the grounds. A colossal, three-headed elephant dominates the structure of The Erawan Museum. The attraction houses a variety of collections owned by museum owner Khun Lek Viriyapant, offering a look into local heritage, customs and craftsmanship. Both inside and out, it's a fascinating space and well worth a visit.

You'll first visit the bridge over the River Kwai, a historical landmark that is part of the Death Railway built by Allied prisoners of war, under control of the Japanese in 1942. You'll also visit the Jeath War Museum to enhance your knowledge and the War Cemetery where thousands of POWs were laid to rest. After a local lunch you'll end the day with a bamboo rafting ride, an elephant trek and time to soak up the beauty of Kanchanburi at the cascading Saiyoknoi Waterfall.

These unconventional paintings use an art technique where two-dimensional pictures are turned into three-dimensional images through the use of optical illusions. There are five zones within the museum: Aqua and Safari, Classic Art, Fantasy, Nature and Modern Art. Float down Venetian canals, venture through the jungle, roam ancient temples and escape a shark attack! The gallery is fully interactive, so you can touch, climb, pose and take photos with all the paintings. Don't make the mistake of thinking this is just for kids, adults get sucked into hours of fun here too! The museum's newest feature interacts with the audience by detecting facial expressions and movement. Swing by and check it out for yourself!

strIntroduction: Visit the ancient city of Ayutthaya, a UNESCO World Heritage Site and once the capital of Thailand Walk through the mystical city of Ayutthaya, and marvel at the ancient ruins and structures around the city Learn about the rich, enchanting history of Buddhism with visits to Wat Yai Chaimongkon, Wihan Phra Mongkhon Bophit and Wat Phra Si Sanphet Savor a delicious local lunch at a riverside restaurant Discover the former glory and grandeur of Ayutthaya with a visit to Bang Pa-In Summer Palace Walk through the mystical city of Ayutthaya, and marvel at the ancient ruins and structures around the city Walk through the mystical city of Ayutthaya, and marvel at the ancient ruins and structures around the city Learn about the rich, enchanting history of Buddhism with visits to Wat Yai Chaimongkon, Wihan Phra Mongkhon Bophit and Wat Phra Si Sanphet Learn about the rich, enchanting history of Buddhism with visits to Wat Yai Chaimongkon, Wihan Phra Mongkhon Bophit and Wat Phra Si Sanphet Savor a delicious local lunch at a riverside restaurant Savor a delicious local lunch at a riverside restaurant Discover the former glory and grandeur of Ayutthaya with a visit to Bang Pa-In Summer Palace Discover the former glory and grandeur of Ayutthaya with a visit to Bang Pa-In Summer Palace What We Love:   What We Love: The Ayutthaya Experience takes you through the historical wonders of Thailand's ancient capital. Ayutthaya is dotted with ruins and grand temples, surrounded by the Chao Phraya, Pa Sak and Lop Buri Rivers, and filled with the aura of mystique and grandeur that truly reflects ancient Thailand. Stop by a 17th century summer palace a fusion of Italian, Thai and Chinese architecture. Visit Wat Yai Chaimongkon, a temple-home to a large reclining Buddha covered in saffron robes. Then drop by the equally intriguing Phra Mongkhon Bophit, a large, bronze-cast Buddha outside the Grand Palace, before being served a hearty lunch at a riverside restaurant. Head to the Wat Phra Si Sanphet, where within its pagodas are enshrined the ashes of three Ayutthayan kings. Roam the Inner City afterward, with glimpses of many a magnificent temple and ruin, wrapping up your journey into olden Thailand.
